page.title: 04CHURNET VALLEY FARMING
page.content: There are many farms on the map but some are not working farms.Most of the farms are quite small with small fields.There are not many crops but grass is grown for hay and silage. Cattle and sheep graze in the fields. Peakstones Farm is a dairy farm with 100 cows and breeds shire horses. Cote Farm is part of a very large farm, Wooton Farm Ltd. owned by Bamfords of JCB,(much outside the block).The farm is 2000 acres altogether but only 10 people work there.There were 1600 ewes and 2700 lambs,100 cows with calves,beef cattle and some bulls. Mrs Bamford has a cow for her own milk.Rabbits are a nuisance and there are a lot of pheasants. The large fields of Cote Farm are surrounded by miles of grey metal fencing. There are no hedgerows but there are copses for wildlife.
